in- dicate that he had now quite finished. 
"Demosthenes, I know thee by the pebble thou secretest in thy golden mouth 1" said Bilf- bin, and the mop of hair on his head moved with satisfaction. 
Everybody laughed, and Hippolyte louder than anyone. He was evidently distressed, and breathed painfully, but could not restrain the wild laughter that convulsed his usually impas- sive features.
